Final year project – Design and develop a car and caravan combo that combines the benefits of the motorhome and the touring caravan industries.
An in-depth design process was used that included ideation, conceptualisation, and client meetings to ensure that all specification requirements were met.
Prototypes were created to ensure size and shapes were attractive and met the requirements, a variety of prototypes were made out of sand, clay, wood and foam (CNC router)
CAD modelling was very important throughout the project to visualise the design and show how everything worked, the packages he used for this were Alias Automotive, Solid Edge, Showcase, Falcon, and the adobe suite.
A 1/10th scale model of the project was made using a variety of methods including rapid prototyping, 3D printing, and woodwork, these were then all brought together to be built and painted.
CAREER SUMMARY
Jan 2022 to date Group Rhodes
Position: Project Manager
Take ownership of internal and external projects throughout the group from the initial quoting stages through to the sign off of the end product.
Improve internal systems and processes working with all staff within Group Rhodes and push forward business development ideas
Dec 2012 to Jan 2022 Carnaud Metal Box ENG
March 2017 to Jan 2022
Position: Service Co-ordinator
Act as the main point of contact for all technical queries, assess them and where required create quotations, raise warranties or allocate appropriate service resources to them.
Manage the service team, making sure they understand what the job is and when where they need to be, including any documentation then needed as well as visa’s. This also included performing their annual appraisals.
Work closely with many parts of the business such as quality and inspection to make sure that we are aware of any and all eventualities we may encounter during the installation and commissioning stages.
Keeping safety as a priority worked alongside the EHS manager to create new risk assessments and method statements and implemented them into every job.
Dec 2012 to Mar 2017
Position: Mechanical Engineer
Process contracts and interpret the customer specification and needs, speak to customers directly to discuss/recommend parts that are needed, involving designing bespoke parts to fit the requirements.
Deal with any problems with machines both on the shop floor and already in the field. This can range from simple problems where a part might need replacing to designing new parts that can be retrofitted to allow a machine to operate quicker.
Maintain an active part within the Staff council (dealing with any employee concerns) The Environmental Committee (discuss and initiate projects that will impact positively on the environment).
Aug 2012 to Dec 2012 Denso Martin
Position: Production Engineer
Get hands on with the machinery and talk to operators to discuss, test and implement improvements that will make the machine safer, easier or faster to operate.
Liaise with the tool room and maintenance to make sure that the project can be completed efficiently and on time as well as making sure it is within budget.
Self-motivation was a key factor in the role as many projects will be initiated based on personal observation, but it was also important to discuss with other engineers, production staff, and technicians.
COMMENT
A confident, adaptable and motivated individual with experience in both design and mechanical roles, excelling in many forms CAD, both 2D and 3D with a keen appreciation to details and learning new things.
With a friendly and approachable persona, he is able to assess and understand the needs of the task in hand and work with others or individually to ensure requirements are met on time and to budget.
